title: Order Block
content:
The indicator forms zones around reversal candles: the boundaries of the bullish block are determined by the last falling candle, and the bearish block by the last rising candle. A reversal candle can be a candle with an extreme high/low for the period or the one preceding it.


To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Period Specifies the quantity of recent candles to include in the calculations.
Ignore wicks Data for calculations is taken between the opening and closing of candles, if the condition is active, otherwise - between high and low.
Transparency This setting allows users to customize transparency of the visual objects on the chart.

Bullish

NameDescription
Last bullish elements number
Bullish color Sets the color for elements with a bullish direction.
Bullish break color Defines the color for a broken bullish element.

Bearish

NameDescription
Last bearish elements number
Bearish color Sets the color for elements with a bearish direction.
Bearish break color Defines the color for a broken bearish element.

POC level

NameDescription
Show POC level Determines whether to display the POC level.
Color Specifies the color for this element.
Width Determines the width of the displayed line.
Line style Specifies the dash pattern used for lines in the chart, allowing selection of styles like solid, dotted, dashed, or custom patterns for visual differentiation

Options:
  • Solid
  • Dash
  • Dot
  • Dash Dot
  • Dash Dot Dot
